DOCNAME: IERONYMAKIS AND OTHERS AND PLEVRAKI v. GREECE
TEXT: The applicants are CARDINAL NORP nationals whose names are held in the ORG ’s case - file . They are represented before the ORG by Mr A. Bafakis , a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants were hired by ORG and were put at the disposal of the NORP forces in GPE , in accordance with an agreement concluded between GPE and GPE .
In DATE ORG ( ORG Διαιτητικό Δικαστήριο ) of GPE considered that the members of ORG ( PERSON δια τας Δυνάμεις ΗΠΑ ) were entitled to a pay rise ( decision no . DATE ) .
On DATE the Minister of Labour vested this decision with executory force ( ministerial decision no . CARDINAL ) . However , the applicants were never given the pay rise in question .
DATE and DATE the applicants were dismissed from their posts because the NORP base where they used to work closed down .

On DATE ORG considered , by majority , that ORG was under no obligation to employ those dismissed from the NORP base . However , on DATE the Deputy Minister of ORG refused to accept the opinion of ORG . On the contrary , he accepted the opinion of the minority to the effect that the persons concerned remained employees of ORG .

Under the NORP legal system , the failure to conclude a collective labour agreement ( συλλογική σύμβαση εργασίας ) gives rise to the intervention of ORG . The final decisions of these courts are regulatory administrative acts ( κανονιστικές διοικητικές πράξεις ) which , following their approval by ORG , have the effect of collective labour agreements . Their non - enforcement gives the interested employees an actionable claim against the ORG .

Several former employees of the NORP forces ( CARDINAL out of CARDINAL ) have brought civil actions before the ordinary courts seeking the readjustment of their salaries on the basis of decision no . CARDINAL . The courts found in their favour ( see , for example , decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of the First Instance Civil Court of Heraklion , upheld by decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of ORG ) . The ORG , which had originally appealed in cassation , withdrew its appeals and has already complied with the ORG judgments .
